answers.author: Derek Johnson
answers.text:
Kendal, 
ICMA has two topic pages that may be of some assistance to you. 
Employee Awards and Recognition:  http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/82/Employee_Awards_and_Recognition#Tab=Documents 
This topic page is a little light on content but there may be some articles/documents that could give you ideas for a new direction.  
Incentives:  http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/topics/kn/Topic/134/Incentives#Tab=Overview 
Without knowing the specifics of your own awards program it's difficult to recommend any specific documents, but the following two may be helpful: the first is an example of what other municipalities are doing. The second is a guide for implementing "pay for performance" policies: 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14783/Employee_Recognition 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301413/Issues_to_Consider_in_Implementing_a_PayForPerformance_Program 
Good luck with your retooling! 
Derek Johnson

author: Kendal Francis
text: My city's "Employee of the Quarter" program needs a facelift, specifically in how the employee is chosen.  I am looking for examples / suggetions of what criteria or process other cities use to select an employee to recognize.  Or, if you have a revolutionary approach to employee recognition  I would love to hear about that too.
title: Employee Recognition Program
